contextId.occurrenceNote: They did these things at the same time. The people were baptized because they repented of their sins. Alternate translation: "When they repented of their sins, John baptized them in the Jordan River" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐβαπτίζοντο ὑπ’ αὐτοῦ ἐν τῷ Ἰορδάνῃ ποταμῷ, ἐξομολογούμενοι τὰς ἁμαρτίας αὐτῶν
contextId.glQuote: They were baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "John baptized him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was baptized by John

contextId.occurrenceNote: "after John was placed in prison." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after they arrested John" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after John was arrested

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people there heard that he was staying at his home" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was heard that he was at home

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the bridegroom will go away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the bridegroom will be taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus makes clear why God established the Sabbath. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God made the Sabbath for mankind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ Σάββατον διὰ τὸν ἄνθρωπον ἐγένετο
contextId.glQuote: The Sabbath was made for mankind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus restored his hand" or "Jesus made his hand the way it was before" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his hand was restored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the young plants. This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it scorched the young plants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the plants were scorched

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "God has given you" or "I have given you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: To you is given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will measure that amount for you, and he will add it to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be measured to you, and more will be added to you.

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to him God will give more ... from him God will take away" or "God will give more to him ... God will take away from him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to him will be given more ... even what he has will be taken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "People had bound him many times" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He had been bound many times

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "he shattered his shackles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his shackles were shattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and heal her and make her live" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that she may be made well and live

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will heal me" or "his power will heal me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the sickness had left her" or "she was no longer sick" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she was healed from her affliction

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Raised" here is an idiom for "caused to live again." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "John the Baptist has been caused to live again" or "God has caused John the Baptist to live again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: John the Baptist has been raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "has become alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: has been raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Herod sent his soldiers to arrest John and had them bind him in prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ Ἡρῴδης, ἀποστείλας ἐκράτησεν τὸν Ἰωάννην, καὶ ἔδησεν αὐτὸν ἐν φυλακῇ
contextId.glQuote: Herod sent to have John arrested and he had him bound in prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "unwashed" explains why the disciples' hands were defiled. It can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "that is, with hands that they had not washed" or "that is, that they had not washed their hands" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is, unwashed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The authorities must execute a person who speaks evil about his father or mother" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ‘ κακολογῶν πατέρα ἢ μητέρα θανάτῳ τελευτάτω
contextId.glQuote: He who speaks evil of his father or mother will surely die

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase explains the meaning of the Hebrew word "Corban." It can be stated in active form. Mark explained the meaning so that his non-Jewish readers could understand what Jesus said. Alternate translation: "I have given it to God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Given to God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We must first feed the children of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the children first be fed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus took away what prevented his tongue from speaking" or "Jesus loosened his tongue" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his tongue was released

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not give a sign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no sign will be given

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "his sight was restored" can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "restoring the man's sight, and then the man opened his eyes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and the man opened his eyes, his sight was restored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the elders and the chief priests and the scribes would reject him, and that men would kill him, and that after three days he would rise up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: would be rejected by the elders ... and after three days rise up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his appearance had changed" or "he appeared very different" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was transfigured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people would hate him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be despised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone will deliver the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The Son of Man will be delivered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After they have put him to death and three days have passed, he" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When he has been put to death, after three days he

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for God to throw you into hell" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be thrown into hell

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in the active form. Alternate translation: "for God to throw you into hell" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be thrown into hell

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will salt everyone with fire" or "Just as salt purifies a sacrifice, God will purify everyone by allowing them to suffer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everyone will be salted with fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone will deliver the Son of Man to" or "they will hand the Son of Man over to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ Υἱὸς τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου παραδοθήσεται τοῖς
contextId.glQuote: the Son of Man will be delivered to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has prepared it" or "God has prepared them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it has been prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) people in general consider these people the rulers of the Gentiles. Alternate translation: "those whom people consider to be the rulers of the Gentiles" or 2) the Gentiles consider these people their rulers. Alternate translation: "those whom the Gentiles think of as their rulers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are considered rulers of the Gentiles

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "For the Son of Man did not come to have people serve him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: γὰρ ὁ Υἱὸς τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου οὐκ ἦλθεν διακονηθῆναι
contextId.glQuote: For the Son of Man did not come to be served

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form or as as a direct quote. Alternate translation: "commanded others to call him" or "commanded them, 'Call him to come over here.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-quotations]])
contextId.glQuote: commanded him to be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "that no one has ever ridden" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has never been ridden

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and no one gives them in marriage" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: are given in marriage

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active verb. Alternate translation: "who rise" or "who rise to live again" [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will certainly punish them with greater condemnation" or "God will certainly punish them severely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These men will receive greater condemnation

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will beat you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be beaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the authorities will sentence the parents to be put to death. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "cause the authorities to sentence the parents to die" or "the authorities will kill the parents" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: cause them to be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Everyone will hate you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be hated by everyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whoever endures to the end, God will save that person" or "God will save whoever endures to the end" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ ... ὑπομείνας εἰς τέλος, οὗτος σωθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: whoever endures to the end, that person will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the sun will become dark" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sun will be darkened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the powers in the heavens will shake" or "God will shake the powers that are in the heavens" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: Mark wants to show his readers that those present were more concerned about money. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We could have sold this perfume" or "She could have sold this perfume" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This perfume could have been sold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "wherever my followers preach the gospel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: wherever the gospel is preached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will scatter the sheep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sheep will be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus warns his disciples that his betrayer is approaching them. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I, the Son of Man, am being betrayed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The Son of Man is being betrayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he had wrapped around himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was wrapped around him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Pilate told his soliders to take Jesus away to crucify him. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "told his soldiers to take him away and crucify him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: καὶ παρέδωκεν τὸν Ἰησοῦν ... ἵνα σταυρωθῇ
contextId.glQuote: then handed him over to be crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: Mark is showing that God himself split the temple curtain. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God split the curtain of the temple in two" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ καταπέτασμα τοῦ ναοῦ ἐσχίσθη εἰς δύο
contextId.glQuote: The curtain of the temple was split in two

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a tomb that someone had previously cut out of solid rock" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: μνήματι ὃ ἦν λελατομημένον ἐκ πέτρας
contextId.glQuote: a tomb that had been cut out of a rock

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the place where Joseph and the others buried Jesus' body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the place where Jesus was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone had rolled away the stone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the stone had been rolled away

contextId.occurrenceNote: The angel is emphatically stating that Jesus has risen from the dead. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "He arose!" or "God raised him from the dead!" or "He raised himself from the dead!" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He is risen!

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "He" refers to anyone. This sentence can be made active. Alternate translation: "God will save all people who believe and allow you to baptize them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He who believes and is baptized will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "he" refers to anyone. This clause can be made active. Alternate translation: "God will condemn all people who do not believe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he who does not believe will be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God took him up into heaven, and he sat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was taken up into heaven and sat
